analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikovāda sutta
translated: Advice to Anāthapiṇḍika

analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati ābādhikaḥ hoti dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: Now on that occasion the householder Anāthapiṇḍika was afflicted, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika addressed a man, saying:

original: “ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi:
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vandāhi
translated: “Come, my good man, go to the Buddha and, on arrival, showing reverence with your head to his feet in my name, say this:

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: ‘Lord, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is afflicted, suffering, & gravely ill.

analyzed: saḥ bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: He shows reverence with his head to your feet.’

original: Yena cāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandāhi:
analyzed: yena ca āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandāhi
translated: And then go to the Venerable Sāriputta and, on arrival, showing reverence with your head to his feet in my name, say this:

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: ‘Venerable sir, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is afflicted, suffering, & gravely ill.

original: So āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandatī’ti.
analyzed: so āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: He pays homage with his head at the venerable Sāriputta’s feet.’

analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kira bhante āyasmā sāriputtaḥ yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: ‘It would be good, venerable sir, if the venerable Sāriputta would visit the house of the householder Anāthapiṇḍika out of compassion.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā🔽tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho so purisaḥ anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamanta
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” he replied, and he went to the Blessed One,🔽and after paying homage to him, he sat down at one side

original: nisinno kho so puriso bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: nisinnaḥ kho saḥ purisaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and delivered his message.

original: “anāthapiṇḍiko, bhante, gahapati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.🔽So bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī”ti.
analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ  saḥ bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: “Venerable sir, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is afflicted, suffering, and gravely ill.🔽He pays homage with his head at the venerable Sāriputta’s feet.”🔽and after paying homage to the venerable Sāriputta, he sat down at one side

original: Yena cāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so puriso āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: yena ca āyasmā sāriputtaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sāriputtam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ purisaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: and delivered his message.

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: “Venerable Sir, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika is sick, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: So āyasmato sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandati;
analyzed: so āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa pāde sirasā vandati
translated: He bows down at the feet of Venerable Sāriputta

analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: and says this:

original: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kira bhante āyasmā sāriputtaḥ yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: ‘It would be good, Venerable Sāriputta, if you would visit the householder Anāthapiṇḍika’s house, out of compassion.’”

analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhībhāvena
translated: Sāriputta consented in silence.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena🔽yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena  yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte
translated: Then, after robing up, Sāriputta and Ānanda took their bowls and robes and went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s house.

original: āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho āyasmā sāriputto anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: āsane nisīdi nisajja kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ anāthapiṇḍikam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: When they arrived, they sat down on the prepared seats. Sāriputta said to Anāthapiṇḍika,

original: “kacci te, gahapati, khamanīyaṁ, kacci yāpanīyaṁ? Kacci te dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti, no abhikkamanti; paṭikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no abhikkamo”ti?
analyzed: kacci te gahapati khamanīya kacci yāpanīya kacci te dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti no abhikkamanti paṭikkama usānam paññāyati no abhikkama uti
translated: “I hope you’re bearing up, householder, I hope you’re getting better. I hope your painful feelings are fading and not growing, that their fading is noticeable, not their growth.”

original: “Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
analyzed: na me bhante sāriputta khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkamaḥ
translated: “I am not well, Sāriputta, I am not getting better. I am very sick.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, balavā puriso tiṇhena sikharena muddhani abhimattheyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā vātā muddhani ūhananti.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante sāriputta balavā purisaḥ tiṇhena sikharena muddhani abhimattheyya evam eva kho me bhante sāriputta adhimattāḥ vātāḥ muddhani ūhananti
translated: Just as if a strong man were to split my head open with a sharp sword, so too, fierce winds cut through my head.

original: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
analyzed: na me bhante sāriputta khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkamaḥ
translated: I am not well, Sāriputta, I am not getting better. I am very sick.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, balavā puriso daḷhena varattakhaṇḍena sīse sīsaveṭhaṁ dadeyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante sāriputta balavā purisaḥ daḷhena varatta khaṇḍena sīse sīsa veṭham dadeyya evam eva kho me bhante sāriputta adhimattā sīse sīsa vedanā
translated: Just as if a strong man were to tighten a tough leather strap around my head, so too, fierce winds are tightening around my head.

original: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena
analyzed: na me bhante sāriputta khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkamaḥ  seyyathā api bhante sāriputta dakkhaḥ go ghātakaḥ vā go ghāta kantevāsī vā tiṇhena go vikantanena
translated: I am in a bad way, with sharp pains, and my body is swollen.

original: kucchiṁ parikanteyya; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta, adhimattā vātā kucchiṁ parikantanti.
analyzed: kucchim parikanteyya evam eva kho me bhante sāriputta adhimattāḥ vātāḥ kucchim parikantanti
translated: Just as if a skilled butcher or his apprentice were to carve up an ox’s belly with a sharp butcher’s knife, so too, Sāriputta, violent winds are carving up my belly.🔽I am not well, Sāriputta, I am not getting better.

original: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante sāriputta, dve balavanto purisā dubbalataraṁ purisaṁ nānābāhāsu
analyzed: na me bhante sāriputta khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkamaḥ  seyyathā api bhante sāriputta dve balavantaḥ purisāḥ dubbalataram purisam nānā bāhāsu
translated: I am in a bad way, with sharp pains, and my body is swollen.

original: gahetvā aṅgārakāsuyā santāpeyyuṁ, samparitāpeyyuṁ; evameva kho me, bhante sāriputta,🔽adhimatto kāyasmiṁ ḍāho.
analyzed: gahetvā aṅgārakāsuyā santāpeyyu samparitāpeyyu evam eva kho me bhante sāriputta 🔽adhimattaḥ kāyasmin ḍāho
translated: Just as if two strong men were to seize a weaker man by both arms and roast him over a pit of hot coals, so too, Sāriputta, there is violent burning in my body.

original: Na me, bhante sāriputta, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo”ti.
analyzed: na me bhante sāriputta khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkama uti
translated: “I am not well, Sāriputta, I am not comfortable. Strong winds are moving my bowels and my head is reeling. I am not getting better, but am declining, not thriving, I am growing worse, not better.”

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “Then, householder, you should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na cakkhuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na cakkhum upādiyissāmi na ca me cakkhu nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the eye, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the eye.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: You should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na sotaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me sotanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na sotam upādiyissāmi na ca me sota nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the ear, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the ear.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: You should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na ghānaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me ghānanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evañhi te, gahapati, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na ghānam upādiyissāmi na ca me ghāna nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti  evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the nose, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the nose.’🔽That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: You should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na jivhaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me jivhānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na jivham upādiyissāmi na ca me jivhā nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: I won’t cling to the tongue, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the tongue.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na kāyaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me kāyanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na kāyam upādiyissāmi na ca me kāya nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the body, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the body.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na manaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manonissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na manaṃ upādiyissāmi na ca me manaḥ nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the mind, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the mind.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na rūpaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me rūpanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na rūpam upādiyissāmi na ca me rūpa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to sights, and my consciousness will not be dependent on sights.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train.

original: Tasmātiha te, gahapati, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:🔽‘na saddaṁ upādiyissāmi …pe…
analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba  na saddam upādiyissāmi pe
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:🔽‘I won’t cling to sounds …🔽smells …

analyzed: na gandham upādiyissāmi 🔽na rasam upādiyissāmi
translated: tastes …

analyzed: na phoṭṭhabbam upādiyissāmi
translated: I won’t cling to tangibles …

original: na dhammaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me dhammanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na dhammam upādiyissāmi na ca me dhamma nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: I won’t cling to thoughts, and my consciousness will not be dependent on thoughts.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

original: ‘na cakkhuviññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhuviññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na cakkhu viññāṇam upādiyissāmi na ca me cakkhu viññāṇa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to eye-consciousness, and my consciousness will not be dependent on eye-consciousness.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

analyzed: na sota viññāṇam upādiyissāmi  na ghāna viññāṇam upādiyissāmi
translated: ‘I won’t cling to ear-consciousness …🔽I won’t cling to nose-consciousness …

analyzed: na jivhā viññāṇam upādiyissāmi
translated: I won’t cling to tongue-consciousness …

analyzed: na kāya viññāṇam upādiyissāmi
translated: I won’t cling to body-consciousness …

original: na manoviññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manoviññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evañhi te, gahapati, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na manaḥ viññāṇam upādiyissāmi na ca me manaḥ viññāṇa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti  evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: I won’t cling to mind-consciousness, and my consciousness will not be dependent on mind-consciousness.’🔽This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

original: ‘na cakkhusamphassaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhusamphassanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na cakkhu samphassam upādiyissāmi na ca me cakkhu samphassa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: I won’t cling to eye-contact, and my consciousness will not be dependent on eye-contact.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

analyzed: na sota samphassam upādiyissāmi

analyzed: na ghāna samphassam upādiyissāmi  na jivhā samphassam upādiyissāmi
translated: nose-contact …

analyzed: na kāya samphassam upādiyissāmi
translated: tongue-contact …🔽body-contact …

original: na manosamphassaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manosamphassanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na manaḥ samphassam upādiyissāmi na ca me manaḥ samphassa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: mind-contact, and my consciousness will not be dependent on mind-contact.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na cakkhusamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me cakkhusamphassajāvedanānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evañhi te, gahapati, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na cakkhu samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi na ca me cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti  evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the feelings born of eye-contact, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the feelings born of eye-contact.’🔽That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na sotasamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi …🔽na ghānasamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi …🔽na jivhāsamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi …
analyzed: na sota samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi  na ghāna samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi  na jivhā samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi
translated: I won’t cling to feelings born of ear contact …🔽nose contact …

analyzed: na kāya samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi

original: na manosamphassajaṁ vedanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me manosamphassajāvedanānissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na manaḥ samphassa jam vedanam upādiyissāmi na ca me manaḥ samphassa jā vedanā nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: mind contact. And my consciousness will not be dependent on feelings born of mind contact.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: So, householder, you should train yourself:

original: ‘na pathavīdhātuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me pathavīdhātunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na pathavī dhātum upādiyissāmi na ca me pathavī dhātu nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the earth element, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the earth element.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourself.

original: Tasmātiha te, gahapati, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:🔽‘na āpodhātuṁ upādiyissāmi …🔽na tejodhātuṁ upādiyissāmi …
analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba  na āpodhātum upādiyissāmi  na tejaḥ dhātum upādiyissāmi
translated: So, householder, you should train yourself:🔽‘I won’t cling to the water element …🔽the fire element …

analyzed: na vāyodhātum upādiyissāmi 🔽na ākāsadhātum upādiyissāmi
translated: the air element …🔽the space element …

original: na viññāṇadhātuṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me viññāṇadhātunissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na viññāṇa dhātum upādiyissāmi na ca me viññāṇa dhātu nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: I won’t cling to the consciousness element, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the consciousness element.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

original: ‘na rūpaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me rūpanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na rūpam upādiyissāmi na ca me rūpa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to form, and my consciousness will not be dependent on form.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

analyzed: na vedanam upādiyissāmi
translated: ‘I won’t cling to feeling …

analyzed: na saññam upādiyissāmi
translated: to perception …

analyzed: na saṅkhāre upādiyissāmi
translated: to volitional formations …

original: na viññāṇaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me viññāṇanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na viññāṇam upādiyissāmi na ca me viññāṇa nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: to consciousness, and my consciousness will not be dependent on consciousness.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “So, householder, you should train yourself thus:

original: ‘na ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me ākāsānañcāyatananissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na ākāsa anañcāyatanam upādiyissāmi na ca me ākāsa anañcāyatana nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to the base of infinite space, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the base of infinite space.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, householder, you should train yourself in this way:

analyzed: na viññāṇaṃ ca āyatanam upādiyissāmi
translated: ‘I will not cling to the base of infinite consciousness …

analyzed: na ākiñcaññāyatanam upādiyissāmi
translated: I will not cling to the base of nothingness …

original: na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me nevasaññānāsaññāyatananissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upādiyissāmi na ca me nevasaññānāsaññāyatana nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: I will not cling to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: It is in this way, householder, that you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, householder, you should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na idhalokaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me idhalokanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na idha lokam upādiyissāmi na ca me idha loka nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I will not cling to this world, and my consciousness will not be dependent on this world.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: It is in this way, householder, that you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, householder, you should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘na paralokaṁ upādiyissāmi, na ca me paralokanissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evañhi te, gahapati, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na para lokam upādiyissāmi na ca me para loka nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti  evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabba
translated: ‘I will not cling to the other world, and my consciousness will not be dependent on the other world.’🔽It is in this way, householder, that you should train yourself.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, householder, you should train yourself in this way:

original: ‘yampi me diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anupariyesitaṁ anucaritaṁ manasā tampi na upādiyissāmi, na ca me tannissitaṁ viññāṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: yam pi me diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anupariyesitam anucaritam manasā tam pi na upādiyissāmi na ca me tad nissitam viññāṇam bhavissati iti
translated: ‘I won’t cling to anything seen, heard, thought, or known, and my consciousness will not be dependent on anything.’

analyzed: evam hi te gahapati sikkhitabbanti
translated: This is how you should train yourself.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati parodi, assūni pavattesi.
analyzed: evam vutte anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati parodi assūni pavattesi
translated: When this was said, Anāthapiṇḍika wept and shed tears.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ anāthapiṇḍikam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Ānanda said to him,

original: “olīyasi kho tvaṁ, gahapati, saṁsīdasi kho tvaṁ, gahapatī”ti?
analyzed: olīyasi khalu tva gahapati sasīdasi khalu tva gahapati iti
translated: “You’re losing your nerve, householder, you’re losing your nerve!”

analyzed: na aha bhante ānanda olīyāmi na api sasīdāmi
translated: “I’m not losing my nerve, Venerable Ānanda.

original: api ca me dīgharattaṁ satthā payirupāsito manobhāvanīyā ca bhikkhū;
analyzed: api ca me dīgharattam satthā payirupāsitaḥ manaḥ bhāvanīyā ca bhikkhū
translated: I’ve served the Teacher and the esteemed monks for a long time,

original: na ca me evarūpī dhammī kathā sutapubbā”ti.
analyzed: na ca me evarūpī dhammī kathā suta pubbā ati
translated: but I’ve never heard such a talk on the Teaching before.”

original: “Na kho, gahapati, gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhāti;
analyzed: na kho gahapati gihīnam odāta vasanānam evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhāti
translated: “Such a talk on the Teaching doesn’t occur to householders wearing white,

original: pabbajitānaṁ kho, gahapati, evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhātī”ti.
analyzed: pabbajitānam kho gahapati evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhāti iti
translated: but only to those who have gone forth.”

original: “Tena hi, bhante sāriputta, gihīnampi odātavasanānaṁ evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhātu.
analyzed: tena hi bhante sāriputta gihīnam pi odāta vasanānam evarūpī dhammī kathā paṭibhātu
translated: “Well then, Venerable Sāriputta, may such talk about the Dhamma be available to the white-clothed lay people.

original: Santi hi, bhante, kulaputtā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti;
analyzed: santi hi bhante kula puttāḥ appara jakkha jātikāḥ assavana tā dhammassa parihāyanti
translated: There are clansmen with little dust in their eyes who are wasting through not hearing the Dhamma.

original: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca ānando anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ iminā ovādena ovaditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṁsu.
analyzed: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro ti  atha kho āyasmā ca sāriputtaḥ āyasmā ca ānandaḥ anāthapiṇḍikam gahapatim iminā ovādena ovaditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkamisu
translated: There will be those who will understand the Dhamma.”🔽Then, having advised the householder Anāthapiṇḍika with this advice, the Venerable Sāriputta and the Venerable Ānanda got up from their seats and left.

original: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati, acirapakkante āyasmante ca sāriputte āyasmante ca ānande, kālamakāsi tusitaṁ kāyaṁ upapajji.
analyzed: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati acira pakkante āyasmante ca sāriputte āyasmante ca ānande kālam akāsi tusitam kāyam upapajji
translated: Then, not long after they had left, the householder Anāthapiṇḍika died and reappeared in the Tusita heaven.

original: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṁ
analyzed: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikaḥ deva puttaḥ abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta vaṇṇaḥ kevala kappa
translated: Then, when the night was well advanced, the Tusita god Anāthapiṇḍika, his beauty illuminating the entire Jetavana,

original: jetavanaṁ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: jetavanam obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, and stood to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto bhagavantaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho anāthapiṇḍikaḥ devaputtaḥ bhagavantam gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi
translated: As he was standing there, Anāthapiṇḍika addressed the Buddha in verse:

analyzed: idam hi tam jetavana
translated: “This Jeta’s Grove,

analyzed: isi saṅgha nisevita
translated: frequented by the Saṅgha of seers,

analyzed: āvuttham dhammarājena
translated: is filled with the Dhamma-King,

analyzed: pīti sañjananam mama
translated: and it gives rise to rapture in me.

analyzed: kammam vijjā ca dhammo ca
translated: Action, knowledge, and Dhamma,

analyzed: sīlam jīvitam uttama
translated: virtue, and the highest life:

analyzed: etena maccā sujjhanti
translated: By these mortals are purified,

analyzed: na gottena dhanena vā
translated: not by clan or by wealth.

analyzed: tasmā hi paṇḍitaḥ posaḥ
translated: Therefore, a wise person,

analyzed: sampassam atthamattano
translated: seeing what’s beneficial for himself,

analyzed: yonisaḥ vicine dhamma
translated: should investigate the Dhamma wisely,

analyzed: evam tattha visujjhati
translated: and thus he’ll be purified there.

analyzed: sāriputtaḥ uva paññāya
translated: Sāriputta is foremost in wisdom,

analyzed: sīlena upasamena ca
translated: in virtue and peacefulness;

analyzed: yaḥ api pāraṅgataḥ bhikkhu
translated: Even a monk who has gone beyond

analyzed: etau aparamaḥ siyāti
translated: is no better than this.”

analyzed: idam avoca anāthapiṇḍikaḥ deva putto
translated: This is what Anāthapiṇḍika said.

analyzed: samanuññaḥ satthā ahosi
translated: The Teacher approved.

analyzed: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikaḥ deva putto
translated: Then Anāthapiṇḍika,

original: “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
analyzed: samanuññaḥ me satthā iti bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi
translated: thinking, “The Teacher has approved of me,” bowed down to the Buddha, circumambulated him, keeping him to his right, and disappeared right there.

original: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyāḥ accayena bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The following morning the Buddha told the monks:

original: “imaṁ, bhikkhave, rattiṁ aññataro devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo
analyzed: bhikkhave rattim aññataraḥ deva putto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta vaṇṇo
translated: “Monks, last night a certain god,

original: kevalakappaṁ jetavanaṁ obhāsetvā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: kevalakappam jetavanam obhāsetvā yena aham tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mama abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: lighting up the entire Jetavana, approached me, bowed, and stood to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho so devaputto maṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho saḥ devaputto mam gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi
translated: As he was standing there, he addressed me with this verse:

analyzed: idam hi tam jetavana
translated: ‘This Jetavana,

analyzed: isi saṅgha nisevita
translated: frequented by the Saṅgha of Seers,

analyzed: āvuttham dhammarājena
translated: is filled with the Dhamma King,

analyzed: pīti sañjananam mama
translated: and it makes me rejoice.

analyzed: kammam vijjā ca dhammo ca
translated: Action, knowledge, and Dhamma,

analyzed: sīlam jīvitam uttama
translated: virtue, and the highest life:

analyzed: etena maccā sujjhanti
translated: By these, mortals are purified,

analyzed: na gottena dhanena vā
translated: not by clan or wealth.

analyzed: tasmā hi paṇḍitaḥ posaḥ
translated: Therefore, a wise person,

analyzed: sampassam atthamattano
translated: seeing what’s good for himself,

analyzed: yonisaḥ vicine dhamma
translated: should investigate the Dhamma wisely,

analyzed: evam tattha visujjhati
translated: and thus he’ll be purified there.

analyzed: sāriputtaḥ uva paññāya
translated: Sāriputta is foremost in wisdom,

analyzed: sīlena upasamena ca
translated: in virtue and peacefulness.

analyzed: yaḥ api pāraṅgataḥ bhikkhu
translated: Even a monk who has gone beyond

analyzed: etau aparamaḥ siyāti
translated: is no better than this.’

analyzed: idam avoca bhikkhave so deva putto
translated: This, monks, is what that god said.

original: ‘Samanuñño me satthā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyī”ti.
analyzed: samanuññaḥ me satthā ati mam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: ‘My teacher approves of this.’ He bowed down, circumambulated me with his right side toward me, and disappeared right there.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When that was said, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

original: “so hi nūna so, bhante, anāthapiṇḍiko devaputto bhavissati.
analyzed: saḥ hi nūna saḥ bhante anāthapiṇḍikaḥ devaputto bhavissati
translated: “Sir, that must have been the god Anāthapiṇḍika.

original: Anāthapiṇḍiko, bhante, gahapati āyasmante sāriputte abhippasanno ahosī”ti.
analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikaḥ bhante gahapati āyasmante sāriputte abhippasannaḥ ahosi iti
translated: The householder Anāthapiṇḍika had faith in Venerable Sāriputta.”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, ānanda.🔽Yāvatakaṁ kho, ānanda, takkāya pattabbaṁ, anuppattaṁ taṁ tayā.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu ānanda  yāvatakam kho ānanda takkāya an uppattam tam tayā
translated: “Good, good, Ānanda.🔽You’ve reached the limit of speculation.

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍiko so ānanda deva putto ti
translated: That was the god Anāthapiṇḍika.”

analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Buddha said.

original: Attamano āyasmā ānando bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.🔽Anāthapiṇḍikovādasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti 🔽anāthapiṇḍikovāda suttam niṭṭhitam paṭhama
translated: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.🔽The first section for recitation on Anāthapiṇḍika is finished.
